title: Marijan Buljat
text:
Marijan Buljat (born 12 September 1981, in <a href="Zadar">Zadar</a>) is a <a href="Croatia">Croatia</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who plays as a <a href="wingback%20%28association%20football%29">wingback</a>. His current club is NK Arbanasi Zadar.
Born in Zadar and a product of the <a href="NK%20Zadar">NK Zadar</a> academy, Buljat moved soon after finishing his youth career to <a href="NK%20Rijeka">NK Rijeka</a>. After a year and a half there he moved in January 2002 to the <a href="2.%20Fu%C3%9Fball-Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> side <a href="SpVgg%20Greuther%20F%C3%BCrth">Greuther Fürth</a>, signing a 2.5-year contract. After featuring in only a few friendlies for the first side and playing mostly for the Greuther Fürth amateur team in the <a href="Oberliga%20Bayern">Oberliga Bayern</a>, he moved in January 2003 back to Croatia, to <a href="NK%20Osijek">NK Osijek</a>. After another one and half there, he was signed, in summer 2004, by <a href="Dinamo%20Zagreb">Dinamo Zagreb</a>. He has played since for the <a href="Croatia%20national%20football%20team">Croatian national team</a>, being a backup player for the squad in <a href="2006%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">2006 FIFA World Cup</a> as well. In January 2007 Buljat's left leg was broken by the Croatia national team striker <a href="Eduardo">Eduardo</a> in training. In a cruel twist of irony Eduardo's own leg was broken by a tackle by <a href="Birmingham%20City%20F.C.">Birmingham City's</a> <a href="Martin%20Taylor%20%28footballer%2C%20born%201979%29">Martin Taylor</a> in 2008. In July 2008 he was reported that he was transferred to biggest Dinamo rival <a href="Hajduk%20Split">Hajduk Split</a> on a free transfer, signing a four-year contract. After securing a first eleven spot in the 2008/2009 season, he was removed from the first team squad in late 2009 for refusing to sign a new contract with a wage cut. A new contract was signed 6 months later, and was set to feature in the first team again, but broke his right leg in training in July 2010, after featuring only in a single league match. He returned to play in 2011, after a 10-month recovery.
